item.title:
R to @notnotstorm: why only 75% instead of something higher?
utilization must be able to freely move above and below the target in order to be a useful signal for demand. 75% leaves enough headroom above target to remain useful as a proxy for demand

item.title:
R to @notnotstorm: EIP-1559 measures demand via utilization
when utilization is >50%, the base fee goes up. when utilization is <50%, the base fee goes down
this is robust. however, forcing an equilibrium of 50% utilization widens the gap between average case and worst case, as detailed above

item.title:
R to @notnotstorm: EIP-1559 separates each tx fee into a base fee and priority fee
the base fee absorbs fee volatility across blocks
users only need to decide on the priority fee, which is relatively constant across blocks. this makes choosing an appropriate fee relatively idiotproof

item.title:
R to @notnotstorm: why do this instead of just raising the gas limit?
raising the target from 50% to 75% gives the same benefit to avg throughput as raising gas limit from 36M to 54M
but the former is way safer against DoS attacks because it does not increase the severity of the worst case load

item.title:
RT by @notnotstorm: Next-slot real-time proving is coming in 2025.
This year I expect multiple zkVM vendors to prove mainnet EVM blocks on GPUs in less than 12 seconds, at <$0.10 per block. Performance numbers will get crazier with SNARK ASICS. Follow the journey on @eth_proofs.
No L1 is poised to benefit from real-time zkVMs nearly as much as Ethereum. zk is how Ethereum scales sustainably, with full validation for stakers and wallets accessible to phones and watches. Real-time zk is the endgame :)
